pullRequest.body:
Generalize `Basis.tensorProduct` and `instance Module.Free.tensor` to CommSemiring and AddCommMonoid, as a follow-up to #10828.

Plus style fixes:
* tidy up LinearAlgebra.DirectSum.Finsupp.lean:
  * delete unused `universe` declaration
  * delete duplicate `open TensorProduct`
  * delete redundant `noncomputable` annotation and associated comment (due to `noncomputable section` in the same file)
  * use `variable`
* delete "typeclass reminders" in "Module.Flat.iff_rTensor_injective'" (no longer needed)
* whitespace fixes
* simplify file structure (`section`/`namespace`/`open`/`variable`)

---

I started by pulling on a thread (deleting `open scoped Classical` from `finsuppTensorFinsupp`), but that deletion itself will be in another PR (#10974).

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
> replace `open Classical` with `DecidableEq` type class implicit arguments
> * add `DecidableEq` elsewhere when needed as a result

This is contentious enough that I'd prefer to see it in its own PR, and not mixed with the rest of this one. Otherwise these changes look good, thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

:v: bustercopley can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/26893722-1ddb-484a-8e40-70bd83024439) for commit f1d361601be765070e82862ab19b1995027ed217.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/3ca763c1-cef6-42f5-b6a3-741d22335b08/to/26893722-1ddb-484a-8e40-70bd83024439) against commit 46974e92276c335b41277addf83df55f8c080702.
!bench
bors r+
:-1: Rejected by label
bors r+

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/2a0d5f46-3b3d-44bc-a519-93593e345b9e) for commit 7c994f79983db71717c63c666f7c07502e6c058e.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/3ca763c1-cef6-42f5-b6a3-741d22335b08/to/2a0d5f46-3b3d-44bc-a519-93593e345b9e) against commit 46974e92276c335b41277addf83df55f8c080702.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8041590984/job/21961040255)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8041590984/job/21961040210)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8041590984/job/21961040027)
Hmm, I think this may still apply; let's wait for a benchmark

I'm clearly misunderstanding something! I don't know what effect `noncomputable` has inside a `noncomputable section`. I assumed it had none.

We could also benchmark with `suppress_compilation` ... I'll try that. [Will `!bench` when build is finished]
I think the reality is that `suppress_compilation` in a super early file has a downstream effect, so none of these change make any performance difference.
Let's just reverse the last commit to keep the diff slightly smaller and merge it.
A style nit: putting the types on a separate `variable` line to the typeclasses makes adding new types to the section slightly less painful, as then you don't have to rewrap everything.
Will do

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: generalize more `DirectSum` results to avoid negation
